BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_Farmer
BackstoryDef.title: farmer
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] lived a simple life, tending to [PAWN_possessive] crops and removing weeds from dawn to dusk. The soil was familiar beneath [PAWN_possessive] hands, steady and honest work. There was pride in knowing that [PAWN_pronoun] helped feed the Imperial Navy, that every harvest kept the soldiers strong and the fleet running.
WIP

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_Recruit
BackstoryDef.title: imperial recruit
BackstoryDef.description: Freshly graduated from boot camp, [PAWN_nameDef] stepped out of the deployment shuttle with barely contained enthusiasm. People said [PAWN_pronoun]'d see real action around the Rimworlds, and [PAWN_nameDef] was about to find out.

On the way to deployment, [PAWN_nameDef] kept thinking about [PAWN_possessive] new station. [PAWN_pronoun] had been told [PAWN_pronoun] would serve under the empire’s new tributary state. [PAWN_nameDef] wondered what [PAWN_possessive] commanding officer would look like—secretly hoping they might be kin.

On the way to deployment, [PAWN_nameDef] rehearsed greetings in [PAWN_possessive] head, unsure which would sound least foolish. [PAWN_pronoun] had heard rumors about the new commander, but none seemed reliable. All [PAWN_pronoun] could do now was step off the shuttle and hope for the best.

The chatter among fresh graduates was all about the officers they’d be serving under. [PAWN_nameDef] listened carefully, filing away every scrap of gossip about the empire’s latest appointments. When [PAWN_pronoun] thought of meeting [PAWN_possessive] commander for the first time, [PAWN_pronoun] couldn’t decide if [PAWN_pronoun] felt dread or anticipation.

[PAWN_nameDef] sat stiffly in the shuttle seat, uniform creases sharp enough to cut. [PAWN_pronoun] imagined what it would be like to stand at attention before [PAWN_possessive] new commander, hoping to make the right impression. If [PAWN_pronoun] spoke too quickly or too slow, it could be the difference between praise and punishment.

Every announcement over the shuttle intercom made [PAWN_nameDef]’s pulse quicken. The next order would bring [PAWN_pronoun] closer to the officer whose command would shape [PAWN_possessive] career. [PAWN_nameDef] told [PAWN_objective]self to focus on the training—but [PAWN_pronoun] couldn’t stop imagining the moment of introduction.

BackstoryDef.title: lucky recruit
BackstoryDef.description: Fresh from boot camp, [PAWN_nameDef] clutched [PAWN_possessive] lucky charm as the shuttle touched down. A new station, a new chain of command—[PAWN_pronoun] straightened [PAWN_possessive] uniform and braced for the first impression.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_Trooper
BackstoryDef.title: imperial trooper
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] joined the imperial navy to protect [PAWN_possessive] people and serve the empress. Though [PAWN_possessive] unit rarely saw combat, the endless drills and exercises kept [PAWN_pronoun] as sharp as the day [PAWN_pronoun] left boot camp.

[PAWN_nameDef] served in the imperial navy. With [PAWN_possessive] service weapon in hand, [PAWN_pronoun] faced countless enemies without hesitation. [PAWN_nameDef] was no superhuman, but [PAWN_pronoun] had the resolve to keep firing when it mattered most.

Patrol duty wore on [PAWN_nameDef], day after day of empty corridors and uneventful shifts. Yet when alarms sounded and real danger appeared, [PAWN_pronoun] moved with precision, every drill and order drilled into muscle memory.

[PAWN_nameDef] developed the habit of sneaking extra naps during patrol shifts, trusting [PAWN_possessive] squadmates to kick [PAWN_objective] awake if an officer passed by. It was a risky gamble, but better than nodding off mid-march.

For [PAWN_nameDef], service in the imperial navy was more than orders—it was purpose. [PAWN_pronoun] trained hard, fought harder, and believed each mission was another chance to honor [PAWN_possessive] oath to defend the empire’s citizens.

[PAWN_nameDef] found no glory in chasing smugglers or standing watch. But when pirates breached the hull and chaos erupted, [PAWN_pronoun] fought hard, every shot a reminder that the navy’s duty was to shield the empire from lawless threats.

In cramped corridors where pulse fire lit the dark, [PAWN_nameDef] stood shoulder to shoulder with [PAWN_possessive] squadmates. The pirates were relentless, but the discipline of the imperial navy carried [PAWN_pronoun] through each firefight.

Most days in the imperial navy felt the same to [PAWN_nameDef]: routine patrols, loud sergeants, and long waits. But during sudden engagements, [PAWN_pronoun] found focus, trading fatigue for discipline and carrying [PAWN_possessive] share of the fight.

[PAWN_nameDef] dreaded the endless march of inspections and drills, but when orders came down, [PAWN_pronoun] carried them out without complaint. In battle, [PAWN_pronoun] wasn’t the fastest or the strongest, but [PAWN_pronoun] was there when the squad needed steady fire.

Life in the navy was not glorious for [PAWN_nameDef]. The food was bland, the beds were hard, and the drills were endless. Still, when enemies closed in, [PAWN_pronoun] did [PAWN_possessive] part, reminding [PAWN_objective]self why [PAWN_pronoun] wore the uniform in the first place.

[PAWN_nameDef] didn’t join the imperial navy for glory. Patrols, drills, and long deployments tested [PAWN_possessive] patience, but [PAWN_pronoun] endured them as the price of protecting the empire’s people. The greater good was never easy, but it was always clear.

[PAWN_nameDef] found comfort in routine—boots shined, uniform straight, bed squared. It wasn’t pride so much as survival; inspection failure meant laps around the barracks, and [PAWN_pronoun] had no love for running.

No matter how serious the mission, [PAWN_nameDef] carried contraband snacks tucked into [PAWN_possessive] kit. Officers tried to confiscate them, but when rations ran low, everyone knew where to look.

[PAWN_nameDef] often drifted through routine duty half-asleep, saving energy whenever possible. But when orders turned sharp and battle began, [PAWN_pronoun] found the strength to rise, driven by instinct and the survival of the squad.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_TrooperVet
BackstoryDef.title: veteran trooper
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] had marched under the imperial banner long enough to see comrades come and go. What endured was the duty itself. [PAWN_pronoun] found comfort in the thought that peace, however fragile, was held firm by the weight of loyal troopers.

[PAWN_nameDef] once dreamed of glory, but years of service shaped that dream into resolve. [PAWN_pronoun] no longer sought recognition—only the certainty that [PAWN_possessive] work preserved peace for those who could not defend themselves.

Years of drills and deployments left [PAWN_nameDef] with little patience for complaints. [PAWN_pronoun] knew the empire’s strength rested on discipline, and discipline rested on soldiers like [PAWN_objective]. Peace was earned through order, never chance.

[PAWN_nameDef] took pride in wearing the navy’s uniform, seeing it as proof of [PAWN_possessive] duty to protect [PAWN_possessive] people. Even during long drills and routine patrols, [PAWN_pronoun] reminded [PAWN_objective]self that every step kept the empire secure.

[PAWN_nameDef] accepted hardship as the burden of a soldier. Endless drills, long watches, and harsh punishments were not for [PAWN_objective]self, but for the people the empire shielded. The emperor’s law was clear, and [PAWN_pronoun] followed it without hesitation.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_TrooperCook
BackstoryDef.title:
culinary trooper navy cook [PAWN_nameDef] was a navy cook. While others drilled with rifles, [PAWN_nameDef] mastered the mess hall stove. [PAWN_pronoun] took pride in serving meals that silenced complaints, if only for a few minutes.
2 4 6

BackstoryDef.description: As a navy cook, [PAWN_nameDef] believed morale began on the plate. A pinch of spice or a clever recipe made routine rations tolerable, and [PAWN_pronoun] became the squad’s most valued presence at mealtime.
[PAWN_nameDef] trained as a navy cook, turning navy rations into meals that almost tasted fresh. [PAWN_pronoun] learned that a good stew kept soldiers sharper than any speech from an officer.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_TrooperMedic
BackstoryDef.title:
medic trooper navy medic As a navy medic, [PAWN_nameDef] served in the medbay as an assistant, fetching tools, holding patients steady, and cleaning wounds under the surgeon’s orders. The work was unglamorous, but every life saved felt like a small victory to [PAWN_objective].
4 4
2

BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a navy medic. Trained only in the basics, [PAWN_nameDef] spent most of [PAWN_possessive] time preparing equipment and following the surgeon’s commands. [PAWN_pronoun] wasn’t a doctor, but [PAWN_pronoun] learned quickly that steady hands and silence mattered more than rank.

[PAWN_nameDef] was a navy medic. Most of [PAWN_possessive] work at the medbay was patching up troopers who got careless during drills or brawled during downtime. [PAWN_pronoun] kept bandages ready and lectures short, knowing the same idiots would be back on the cot before long.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_ShockTrooper
BackstoryDef.title: shock trooper
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] served as an imperial shocktrooper, clearing corridors and bunkers with scatter-fire and explosives. Where regular troopers stalled, [PAWN_pronoun] broke resistance wide open.
Imperial shocktroopers like [PAWN_nameDef] thrived in close combat. A single blast from [PAWN_possessive] pulse blaster or the detonation of a TD charge was often enough to decide the battle.
As an imperial shocktrooper, [PAWN_nameDef] was always first through the breach. Pulse blaster raised, TD charges at the ready, [PAWN_pronoun] lived to turn strongholds into rubble.

As an imperial shocktrooper, [PAWN_nameDef] led boarding charges with a pulse blaster and a belt of thermal detonators. Close quarters was brutal work, but it was the empire’s way of ending fights quickly.

Imperial shocktroopers like [PAWN_nameDef] were the first through the breach. Pulse blaster in hand, TD charges primed, [PAWN_pronoun] embodied the empire’s doctrine: crush resistance swiftly, leave nothing standing.

As an imperial shocktrooper, [PAWN_nameDef] boarded enemy ships with [PAWN_possessive] pulse blaster in hand and TD charges primed. Bulkhead by bulkhead, [PAWN_pronoun] cleared the corridors, leaving the vessel ready for the empire to claim.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_RailgunTrooper
BackstoryDef.title: railgun trooper
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a recon trooper in the Imperial Navy. [PAWN_pronoun] rarely spoke first but listened closely, always watching. The cool exterior hid nerves, but when the pulse railgun fired, it was clear [PAWN_pronoun] knew exactly what [PAWN_pronoun] was doing.

[PAWN_nameDef] was a recon trooper in the Imperial Navy. Silent and unnoticed, [PAWN_pronoun] moved through shadows, pulse railgun always at the ready. [PAWN_pronoun] didn’t need to speak—one clean shot was all that mattered. The world didn’t know [PAWN_pronoun] was there until it was too late.

BackstoryDef.Name: CFAR_Lieutenant
BackstoryDef.title: lieutenant
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] was a lieutenant in the Imperial Navy. Orders were clear, but troopers always added their own spin. It drove [PAWN_objective] nuts, but deep down, [PAWN_pronoun] knew [PAWN_possessive] squad was loyal through and through.

[PAWN_nameDef] was a lieutenant in the Imperial Navy. [PAWN_pronoun] knew the troopers tested limits and took chances, but sergeants kept them grounded. Where [PAWN_pronoun] issued orders and made plans, sergeants enforced discipline and settled disputes. The two ranks worked side by side, one controlling chaos through command, the other through force.
